name: youtubedl-material
description: YoutubeDL-Material is a self-hosted web front-end for yt-dlp/youtube-dl. It lets users queue, download, and manage videos and audio from many sites, storing them in organized folders with metadata.
features: Web interface: Download videos and audio from YouTube and hundreds of other sites through a modern browser UI.
Queue management: Add multiple URLs to a download queue and process them sequentially or in parallel.
Format selection: Choose video quality, audio-only downloads, or specific formats before starting downloads.
Subscription system: Subscribe to channels and playlists to automatically download new content as it's published.
Archive mode: Track previously downloaded videos to avoid duplicates when monitoring channels.
Metadata organization: Store videos with proper filenames, thumbnails, and metadata in organized folder structures.
User accounts: Create multiple users with individual download histories, subscriptions, and storage quotas.
Download history: Review all past downloads with search, filtering, and re-download capabilities.
Audio extraction: Download audio-only files in MP3, M4A, or other formats for music and podcast archiving.
Playlist support: Download entire playlists or channels with a single URL and automatic indexing.
Custom arguments: Pass advanced yt-dlp arguments for specialized download scenarios and edge cases.
API access: Trigger downloads programmatically using REST API endpoints for automation and integrations.
